alert.note: Alert for Delaware (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 25 at 2:03PM EDT until July 25 at 5:45PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR NORTHEASTERN NEW CASTLE AND SOUTH CENTRAL DELAWARE COUNTIES... At 203 PM EDT, trained weather spotters reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain in Chester. Between 1 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Trained spotters reported. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets, and underpasses. Some locations that may experience flash flooding include... Wilmington, Chester, Arden, Chester Township, Nether Providence Township, Brookhaven, Upland, Eddystone, Marcus Hook, Parkside, Trainer, and Bellefonte. This includes the following highways... Interstate 95 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 0 and 6. Interstate 95 in Delaware between mile markers 18 and 23. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
